meanings.definition: The belief in a supernatural power that animates all living things.
meanings.sent1: The tribe's animatism led them to worship the spirits of nature.
meanings.sent2: Animatism is a common theme in many indigenous cultures.
meanings.sent3: The animatism of the ancient tree made the villagers believe it had magical powers.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the animatism of the river symbolized the flow of life itself.
meanings.sent5: The shaman spoke of the animatism of the wind, connecting all beings in harmony.

meanings.definition: The attribution of consciousness to natural objects or phenomena.
meanings.sent1: The animatism of the mountain was believed to bring good fortune to the village.
meanings.sent2: Some cultures practice animatism by communicating with the spirits of the land.
meanings.sent3: The animatism of the talking rock amused the children, who thought it whispered secrets.
meanings.sent4: The animatism of the stars in the night sky seemed to watch over the travelers on their journey.
meanings.sent5: The animatism of the thunderstorm made the villagers seek shelter from the angry sky.

meanings.definition: The belief in a universal life force that governs the universe.
meanings.sent1: The animatism of the cosmos was thought to guide the destiny of all beings.
meanings.sent2: Ancient civilizations often held animatism as a central tenet of their belief systems.
meanings.sent3: The animatism of the sun's rays brought warmth and light to the world.
meanings.sent4: The animatism of the ocean's tides mirrored the ebb and flow of life itself.
meanings.sent5: The animatism of the moon's phases influenced the cycles of nature and agriculture.
